page.title: 11HOUSING, CLIFTON HAMPDEN
page.content: In the village itself most of the houses are pretty thatched cottages which are very old and very expensive to buy. The proximity of the Culham Laboratories and the situation on the River Thames also help to increase the prices. This means that people who move here are normally on their second or third houses or retiring. There are a few new houses on the edge of Clifton Hampden and the houses at the western end of Burcot have been built within the last twenty years. Most of Clifton Hampden, Burcot and the surrounding land used to be owned by the Gibbs family. In recent years much of the land has been sold. At the time when this happened plans were put forward for a new housing estate. These were firmly opposed by the present residents and were finally rejected.
